name: Ana F
text: Yuri and Jennifer were so nice when we visited the store. They answered all of our questions and concerns. I didn’t receive a MetroPcs survey for them so I wanted to post to say just how awesome they were!

name: David Goodwin
text: They got phones an will fix you up with a good one

name: Vicki Irons
text: The workers went way out of their to help me transfer all my stuff to my new phone!

name: Wayne Earp
text: I bought a defective phone from them and when i called the store a few days later they took my information and said they would call me when the new phone came in after two weeks and i haven't heard anything so i called back and then they tell me we don't take information over the phone i would have to come to the store which i did only to be informed i waited to long which was less than 30 days. Do not buy a phone or get service through metro they don't stand behind what they sell.

name: King David
text: The Black broad with the bug eyes and the fake eyelashes was super rude. I came in looking for phones and didnt see anything I liked so I left, stood outside and waited for my uber. She said I couldnt stand outside and she was closing. I said I thought you closed at 8? Its 7 she said well not today. I moved to the parking lot and waited, she came and said you cant stand there either, I just laughed because I know she wanted a reaction. She said Im not playing Ill call the police. Since when can the police do something if you arent soliciting or hanging after business hours? LOL she was a funny character. Thanks Alabama.

resp.text: I'm sorry you didn't have the experience we always want to provide for our customers! We always want to serve our customers in the best possible way. We do appreciate you coming by our store, and we hope to see you again in the future to provide you the best possible experience!

name: Juran Gulley
text: The person that assisted me was very professional and kind I really recommend him totally awesome thank you so much will return soon

name: Jennifer Vines
text:
They ripped me off
I paid $99 for a upgrade and added a line. I was supposed to get a second phone for free. They said there wasn't a special going.
The corporate Customer Care number asked them to give me the phone when I went back the next day, (after a few long convos w corporate), and they would pay the owner for the phone if they had to.
They were false advertisng to get the $99 upgrade for half off when you add a line and upgrade, then said that special was over when they still had the advertisements for the special by the phones.
I was told it changed to buy one at $99 and get one free w upgrade and added line the next day.
Rip off scam artists whose employee probably sold my, "free", phone online.
I even paid the $25 fee to add the line as well as activation for the phone I NEVER RECEIVED.
Switching carries A.S.A.P. after being a customer for 5+ yrs due to this.
The same man owns the Homewood store, so be wary of rip offs there as well!

name: Aaa Ouda
text: Worst of the worst

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear this. That’s not the experience we want for our customers! Can you email me at DLRBirminghamNorthFeedback@T-Mobile.com so I can get this fixed for you?

name: Fred Utley
text: Good service good employers I'm always glad to visit them !

name: j
text: I was in need of a new phone and I saw that metro pcs has a deal if you switch carriers you can get a phone for $49. I called the store to find out how much would it cost for phone plus activation and was told $170.when I went to the store later that same day the guy at the counter that waited on me told me the price was $180.after explaining I got an earlier quote for $170 he obliged. I received a case with the phone thinking it was complimentary. I looked at my receipt a few days later and discovered not only did they charge me for a case I didn’t ask for they also charged me for antivirus software I didn’t ask for. I could not get the guy who waited on me to give me a refund on the case because I already had a case for the phone I contacted the manager and he would not refund me either he then told me I got a good deal on the phone and should be satisfied and suggested I could bring the phone back and get a refund. I will be contact corporate office to get resolution.it is not a lot of money but it’s my money and I have the right to spend my money the way I choose and not have someone to cheat me out of it.Bad Business Practices

name: M
text: The Crestwood location is Awesome!!! I have been to 4 another location today. Thank you Gabriel. You Rock.

name: Gabe B
text: These people are great with customer service the black guy knows exactly what he’s talking about and is 100% honest about any phone you ask him about I felt like I was talking to a friend and not a employee

name: John Bertram
text: the two photos I just added are false addvertisment... they told me I didn't win anything it was for new customers to get a 59.99 or less phone free to sign up.... the front says I won a prize from them she tells me all the dealers are different... but it has your name and address to present it to you... again with out reading the card she says its for new customers... i said it doesn't say that on this card the guy sitting there in the back tells me to stop sticking it in her face.. I told him she was sitting down behind the counter and I'm standing up behind the counter how you see I'm sticking it in her face he says let me see it and wads it up and heads for the trash can,,, when I asked what was he doing he says I'm throwing it away like I did 9 or 10 others today... I told him that was mine and I wanted it back he says of but you need to leave this store you didn't WIN anything.... the card plainly states the address of the store... and it plainly states to give it to them to get your prize... I was denied the prize and was told I read the card wrong and that not all dealers are the same... they tell me that every time i ask them a question... I WILL get that charger and I will see a lawyer about this A.S.A.P.  I am A PCS CUSTOMER!!! CARD DOES NOT STATE CUSTOMER OR NOT... SO BEING THAT I AM A PCS USER I'M AUTOMATICALLY NOT A WINNER OF ANYTHING BECAUSE IT WASN'T THERE MOUTHED RULES THAT ARE NOT STATED ON THIS CARD THAT SAYS I WON A CHARGER OR A SELFIE STICK... I WANT MY CHARGER !!!

name: Mildred Browley
text: When I started my service at MetroPCS here at this location I purchased a phone  one day and I paid out of pocket  $160  the phone I purchase  was supposedly free  and I end up paying $30 for the phone  never got a refund  the next day  I went back  and purchased a new phone  at $59 I paid out of pocket for activation fee  and for switching devices I paid $170 I went back about a week ago to get my phone reset back 2 Factory settings the young lady told me that she couldn't unlock it because I have put my password in too many times and I would have to purchase a new phone when I called MetroPCS the gentleman on the phone gave me instructions on how to unlock the phone and reset it I was very happy but I have a problem with the employees at this location and they have had multiple complaints about them they need to be reported to MetroPCS

name: Nelson Jancaterino
text:
I went in Saturday for my free upgrade to the Samsung 9 note. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and i have to admit they have a great taste in music. The sales associate was still new to the system so it took a little longer than normal, but he was very nice and we've all been there with a new job so it was cool. The assistant manager was extremely knowledgeable and thorough when explaining the new lease, and i have to say a great teacher when it came to helping the new sales associate, which i very much appreciated, and the store manager was also engaging as helpful and nice to his staff.

While i was there, a customer came in fairly aggravated at another store and i could tell he wanted to take it out on the sprint store folks. All the members of the sales team calmly and politely answered his questions, and treated him with respect. They answered his questions and he left a little less aggravated.
Other customers who came in seemed to know the employees very well and the employees knew them. It was almost like being at one of those old mom and pop stores where everyone knows one another.

All in all it was a great experience and i will choose this location, and sprint, from now on.

name: Drew Holloman
text: By far the best Sprint store I've visited. We went in on a Friday, the day the iPhone Xs and Xs Max were shipped. Malcolm was very helpful as well as Quentin. Malcolm assisted my in choosing the best screen protector for her new phone as well as a good reliable case. They setup the liquid glass on her screen and even registered it for her as well. Great customer service. Malcolm even assisted me with the questions I had about my phone and working on my upgrade. The next day, he called and asked how the phone setup had went and he even informed me of what I would pay out of pocket for my damage fee and being able to proceed with pre-ordering my iPhone Xs Max. This was the very next day, Saturday. Malcolm called us that following Tuesday to let me know that my phone had arrived. Later that day after work, I went in and also had liquid glass installed and new case. The activation and transfer process was quick and easy. Again, great customer service from Malcolm and the team at this Sprint store.

I RECEIVED NO COMMUNICATION FROM  MONROEVILLE. NO ONE SHOWED UP. ALSO MEDIACOM HAS CASHED MY $224.00 CHECK BACK IN MAY FOR INSTALL AND SERVICE.  NEVER HAD THESE PROBLEMS WITH DISH.  WHERE IS MY JULY 21 INSTALLER?

Mediacom did respond and sent another tech who redid the wiring outside my home and put inside of a box. He also improved my internet.
Thank you. TV service is excellent.

There is a problem with scheduling and  communication, between the telephone team throughout the US, local technicians, and the customers.  Raised the rating. Thank you for your interest.

resp.text: We apologize if our service doesn't meet your expectations and would like to know more about your experience to ensure any issues are resolved. Please email us at SocialMediaTeam@mediacomcc.com and we'll be happy to help. Also, if our representatives were able to assist you, let us know by changing the review score. This will help us know where the improvements are.

name: Angel S.
text: Terrible service and customer service been waiting 3 weeks for my wife to be fixed had an appointment a week ago the tech never called or showed and they rescheduled me for a week after that and still no show. DO NOT GET MEDIACOM

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your review and for bringing this to our attention! We strive to provide better services and a customer experience than this, and we would like the opportunity to address this with you. Please feel free to reach out us at socialmediateam@mediacomcc.com with any questions or concerns that you have and we will work to improve your overall service experience with us. Please send the account number, the address of the office you reviewed, and a summary of the issues. This way our total care representatives can track this issue and assist you with getting this resolved. Thank you! Also, if our representatives were able to assist you, let us know by changing the review score. This will help us know where the improvements are.

resp.text: Hey Bobby, we’re sorry you had to wait and we want to figure out how we can make things better for you!  At T-Mobile we offer many self service options to pay your bill so you won’t have to wait.  You can pay your bill online through the T-Mobile app, on the web at T-Mobile.com, or over the phone by dialing 611 from your T-Mobile device.  If you would like to pay in the store and have a reduced wait you can always schedule an appointment online at https://www.t-mobile.com/store-locator as many of our customers do.  Please call me at 256-301-1830 so we can chat!

name: Karen Graham
text: This establishment is a joke. My mother's phone was set to Spanish language somehow.  She took the phone back in and was told there was nothing they could do to convert it back to English.  She even talked to the manager who was at the Prattville store at the time.  The manager told her there was nothing they could do.  She was told that she could purchase another phone.  Fast forward, my mother called me, I googled the words in Spanish to get her into the the languages so that she could select English as her primary language.  This is an example of poor quality customer service.  If it were not for me, she would have been out of more money for no reason.  I would advise anyone to think twice before getting service with this establishment.  The only good quality you receive is when you exchange money from your hand to theirs.  Otherwise a waste of service. Please go someplace else.

name: Rob Michael
text: What a great experience I had at this T-Mobile location.  I had originally purchased a phone from the Florence location for my daughter and it started having issues on day one.  We took it back to that location 2 times and of course they did their diagnostic tests on it, reset it twice and then sent us on our way.  Apparently i got a "bad APPLE" because none of this fixed the problems.  Fed up with this location, I decided to visit the Muscle Shoals location.  Let's just say that this will be my "go to" store going forward.  I was greeted by Nicole and she was absolutely amazing.  She presented the issues we were having to her manager "Trinidad" I think was his name and he agreed that the phone was bad.  They didn't have that exact color of phone in stock so she asked if I would be willing to drive to the Decatur store to get one.  I said yes so then she proceeded to call that location and told them everything.  She set everything up with a rep at that store and we swapped the phone out.  Thanks for listening to our problems and handling it professionally!  You guys rock!

text: Since starting with Cspire my bill was never the same it changed month to month. My contract finally came to a close went to the store to close it out paid my final bill all was well until 6 months later i get a collection notice in the mail saying i owed them $200 dollars. called cspire they said people at the store told me wrong and the person who was supposed to update my info the last time when dealing with the auto pay stuff neglected to do so. So it was pay them 200 dollars  or they were going to confirm to collections i owed this debt. Long story short go somewhere else this company is a joke.

name: Summer Newell
text:
I have been with CSpire for over 5 years. Today I received a letter in the mail telling me that I have been using my phone outside of the network. I haven't changed anything with what I have been doing and I haven't been anywhere out of the ordinary. Now I'm being told that they are going to terminate my service and I will have to turn in my phone. I was also told that if I now use my phone, outside of their network, that I will be charged. Now I have to purchase new phones and find a new carrier, because they changed something. "Customer Inspired", that's complete crap. You wouldn't kick a loyal customer to the curb if so. Thank you for costing my family stress and money all because you decided to change something. Never will I ever refer somebody to this company again.

If you live in or around Pensacola, Fl beware. Cspire will cut your service for absolutely no reason whatsoever AND make you pay for it.

#cspire #customerinspired #unlesstheyreloyal

When we went to the Gasden Hwy location they said we could switch the phones with no problem, they only thing was they didnt have the color we wanted. So, we went to the Centerpoint location and the lady told us we couldnt do it even though I told her we had to just left their other location and they were going to do it. She just gave us a very nonchalant attitude and proceeded like she was done with us and was going to help someone else. She didnt even try contacting the other store. She was just like sorry i cant help you. We left here and went back to Gasden Hwy and they did it for us with no problems or extr charge. I know this is bad to say but I knew that because the location of the store, the rep was going ot give us problems. name: Wendy L
text: At this location, one of the employees, Tamika, recognized a scam artist was trying to take advantage of an elderly family member on our plan. Tamika called me, the account owner, to explain what she was concerned about after the elderly family member had been in her store for help with her phone. Because of Tamika's quick thinking to call me, our family was able to find out that indeed, our elderly family member was being scammed. We cannot thank Tamika enough for going above and beyond to help us! It is employees like this who make Metro a company our family trusts! Tamika was looking out for our elderly family member, and made us aware of something that we had no knowledge of. THANK YOU Metro and THANK YOU, Tamika! Our family is eternally grateful!

When I after she had another one if if I had everything in cash. I thought this was a very odd question I said excuse me she said our machines are down and I can't do anything for you you're going to have to go get the cash. She said it was such attitude and so rudely I will never go back there again. What kind of business only accept cash over $300 purchase. I'm sorry but most people carry around credit card. text: Had a great experience yesterday ported 4 lines from Sprint and received all 4 Lg Stylos for FREE. Both guys I dealt with were very nice, professional and helpful. I had went to a Metro in Mobile and they told me I could only get 1 free Stylo even if I was porting 4 lines and that the 4 free phones only applied if you bought 3 other cheaper phones and that I could not get 4 of the same phone which made absolutely no sense so I came to the Daphne location and did not have one single issue. Do yourself a favor go to the Metro PC in Daphne ONLY.

District mngr could have done SOOOOO  many things different to have kept our business beginning with elementery  communication but instead he did everything wrong costing us of a lot of time energies and emotions. name: Diane Herron
text: Deceptive practices, bait and switch phone price. They will tell you anything to get you to run a credit check. After they have run a credit check they will not honor the price point they have marked in the store. They assume you will accept anything, since they have run a credit check. I cancelled the transaction, however they still charged me $33.00 for sim cards I do not have, and were to refund, but they did not. The company as a whole is deceptive. They don't care about YOU...the customer. The agent named Jason was rude, and inept. He blatantly lied to me. He refused to call a supervisor, stating they were unavailable. Then, when he was not even able to to cancel my transaction, low and behold he stepped to the back and called them on his cell phone and the walked him through cancelling my account. However they still have not refunded me. When I call TMobile main number, all I was given was a written address to submit my complaints to.

resp.text: Hello! We would like to know more about your experience. Your feedback is appreciated and will be used to improve our operations. If you have another moment, please text 611 and we will take the necessary steps to improve your experience. Thank you! -C Spire

name: Glen Johnson
text: I had service with C Spire for approximately 3 years. Overall I was happy with C Spire. I found a better deal and decided to switch my service to a new provider. In doing so I found out that C Spire, like every other phone and cable provider, bills in advance. No problem. Unlike every other such provider, however, C Spire does not rebate the unused portion of the last billing cycle.  Even AT&T and Comcast, notorious for their poor customer service, rebate the unused portion of the last billing month. It is hard to reconcile the image C Spire likes to project of a friendlier cell phone service provider with a billing practice that takes advantage of their customers.

resp.text: Hi Glen, we hate to hear that you decided to change service.  When a disconnect request is received with C Spire, the phone remains active until the end of the billing period due to the fact that it has already been billed.  If you would like more information on this policy, please email us at social@cspire.com.

name: Julia Milstead
text: When everything is working properly the internet, television, and phone service is good. When there is an outage the customer service is terrible. The wait time for a service call is normally over a week! Most of the outages are resolved before the service call is done, which would indicate a problem on MediaCom’s side rather than a problem with the in home equipment. Neighbors have the same issue, burnt I am always told there are no outages in the area and that my problem is an isolated one. I am very frustrated with the customer service. I have been a Mediacom customer for many, many years, but if I had any other option I would definitely change!!

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your review and for bringing this to our attention! We strive to provide better services and a customer experience than this, and we would like the opportunity to address this with you. Please feel free to reach out us at SocialMediaTeam@mediacomcc.com with any questions or concerns that you have and we will work to improve your overall service experience with us.Also, if our representatives were able to assist you, let us know by changing the review score. This will help us know where the improvements are.

Please send the account number, the address of the office you reviewed, and a summary of the issues. text: I went over there and was told if I joined on with T Mobile I would get two lines for $130 plus a third line free before autopay. So I joined and a couple weeks later get a bill for $185 part of that was being charged $25 for a third line. Went up there to figure out what's going on. Apparently the girl who signed us up didn't realize this promotion expired ( not my fault) and the plan changed to $185. On top of that they raised the two lines from $130 to $155. The sales manager did credit back the amount that was owned to me. However their corporate office said they would not honor the price they told me from here on out. On top of all that BS we also got our Netflix signed on with them because that was part of the plan, two days after doing that our account got hacked. Save yourself the misery because any company who doesn't honor thier screw up is a joke...

name: Ms_ shenice
text: I had a horrible experience on 4/27 at 922 Ann St Montgomery,Al . I went in to upgrade my and I was super excited because it would be my first iPhone . The store associate LaQuita Miles , the other team members were calling her by her nick name Shay was very rude and disrespectful.. she had an attitude the entire time helping me. So she tells me I had to pay $70 downpayment .I let her know that I looked online and it said there wasn't a down payment needed . She got defensive and said well this is what it's saying . She then said if you wanted to jumped then it would be free. I said well you didn't tell me that . She looked right at me and said it's not her job to explain that to me because it was previously explained to me when I initially got the jump service ....I couldn't believe she was talking to me like this and the fact that she said it's not her job to explain anything to was disgusting . I then proceeded to walk out because I didn't like how she was to talking to me and was going to go to another store ...she made a gesture of rolling her neck while my back was turned to leave and my niece saw it ... she exchanged words with my niece and they began to argue ... I asked to speak to the manager  . The manager Will came out and he could get her to stop arguing with my niece another store  associate had to stand in front of her because she was moving toward my niece as if she was going to assault her ...Eventually after being asked several times to got to the back she went . I was there for 4 hours trying to transfer my info over from my galaxy phone to the iPhone . The whole time we were there the employee Shay was in the back on the clock , sitting in the back. Also I was the one who had to google how to do a hard reset on google because the manager Will had something else  that he needed to do and the store associate that he left to help us couldn’t reset the phone and wipe out my info . Not once did Will apologize for the behavior of the employee Shay , he was even going along with her trying to justify her telling me it's not her job to explain things to me . There also was not an apology given for the long time we were in the store . I've been wit he T-Mobile for 9 years and I pay my bill with my hard earned money and the slap in the face I received that day at that store was disgusting ....also the whole time I was there the other girl store associate with pink hair was rolling her eyes at us I guess her and the Shay girl were friends . I still can't believe how we were treated that day ...Also the long wait was due to transferring my messages over to my iPhone which never happened important messages that I needed were lost ... With ppl recording things and putting them on social media this incident with you're store associate could have turned into a viral video . I hope this is looked into so no one else has to have the same horrible experience I had . We came in the store around noon and didn't leave until a little before 4pm

text: To bad you can't give a zero star rating, they straight up lied to me. No phone coverage at my house and hardly no coverage where I go. After being billed they said it was only that for the first two bills then it would be $60. Well how can I trust them since they already lied. Then I asked to pay off the phone and unlock it and I would just go back to att and was told that they couldn't unlock it unless I keep it with them for 6 months. I never did a contract and payed $60 for the phone,  so I can just throw the phone away no problem, but T-Mobile has no coverage if you travel, may be good if you never leave town but that's about it.

name: Mr. Monday
text:
Where to start...

I went to this location to start a new line of service. In the process I was also canceling a current line I had on my wifes service to be more cost efficient. When I asked if I was going to have to pay the back bill the guy working said if I canceled before a specific date I wouldn't have to. Got the new phone, got the service set up, easy breezy.

When I called Sprint to cancel the phone I was informed that it couldn't cancel until after the next billing cycle. I informed them what the store had told me and they said since there wasn't any notes they couldn't honor what I was told.

Naturally, I was irritated I was going to have to pay for something I wasn't expecting. When I called the store to have the issue resolved they attempted to call Sprint again and do the same thing I had done. No results again.

Now, a month later, I am still battling this issue. The store manager, Roderick, claimed to have lost my information. He knew the situation and claimed he thought I was talking about another line (not the one we had discussed multiple times). He tried to make me feel like the bad guy by saying he was working on the issue during his vacation. He asked for my social security number and read it back to me aloud in a store with other people in the room.

Do not do business with this store. They are unprofessional. They are not worth the headache. This is not a slam on Sprint as a service provider. They are a great provider.

If i could give no stars I would.

text: Ok the people are very friendly and ready to help very nice.

text: I wish there was less than 1 star. I absolutely hate this company. Unfortunately there is no provider in my area. text: I have never felt so ripped off by a company. Century link is the only internet provider in our area, and I have to have internet for my at home business or I would drop them in a heartbeat. most of the time our internet is so slow it will not even allow me to stream a movie without stopping at some point in the middle. not to mention we are paying nearly triple the cost of the internet service we had at our last house.

name: Blair White
text: Century Link is by far the worst internet service provider in Alabama and maybe in the southeast. If you live in Foley, AL, you have no choice but to go with Century Link for Internet service. You pay top dollar for extremely slow internet that doesn't work half the time especially after 6 pm on week days. It is mind blowing to me that in the year 2015, cable internet is not offered in Foley, AL. People think that I live in the middle of no where when I tell them that cable internet is not an option. But I just say no, I actually live right in the middle of a city. It's just a city that allows only one internet provider which is called a monopoly which is illegal!! Century Link and this monopoly is so ridiculous, my family and I would seriously consider moving just to get away from it! Which is completely unacceptable that we would have to do that!! Ugh I hate Century Link!!!!

name: Michael Hunt
text:
I have bonded DSL.  2 months no problem, satisfied with the service, but I don't have a contract so I am paying a ridiculous $85.00 a month for 15 down/2 up which has averaged in that area.  I am on a work site and don't need another contract to break so this was the way to go.  I have no phone.  Yesterday I had to create a skype number because of cell phone problems.  Guess what?  My internet is throttled today.  If I go to the "Century Link" speed test it shows I am pulling 15.1 down/1.51 up.  Of course I am not every other speed test shows with the closest local in Daphne AL at 2.46 down/ up 1.47.  In fact most of the other non centurylink speed test show a higher upload on about 1 then download.  I've reset the equipment and the desktop is directed wired.  The equipment is up and on par.
This is clearly throttling and should be illegal.  I've had no warning that I hit some limit.  Trying to located a real human to take to is impossible slow and hard to locate.  Do not use the worthless chat its a no go and a pawn in modern customer service.  I can't wait to get out of here and back home with Fiber optic.  The rural people better pay attention to the fish they elect that spawn with the corporate cows.  The internet is not a luxury for a mobile advanced society.  Get it regulated and make these suckers deliver what they are selling at high prices.

name: Blair White
text: Century Link is by far the worst internet service provider in Alabama and maybe in the southeast. If you live in Foley, AL, you have no choice but to go with Century Link for Internet service. name: Aaron Mahan
text:
I’ll save you time, if you’re trying to use an online promotion that you think may be slightly questionable (ex. “Does this apply to me?”) and don’t want to be harassed for it, avoid this store at all costs.

I had one of the worst customer service experiences in my life at this store, and if a T-Mobile Customer Service rep hadn’t called me and gave me one of the  customer service experiences my life, I would have left T-Mobile without a second thought. After walking into the store we were greeted by an older, larger man. He was initially standoffish and not very welcoming until we mentioned that we were there to buy new phones.

Everything was mostly fine, until I asked about a promotion at for the new Galaxy S10. The promotion was for a new, qualifying line you’d get a large portion off of the phone. Because of the situation of adding a line for my wife from a different carrier, I wanted to see if we could count that for the S10 and then get her iPhone XS discount with her trade in. He insisted there was no way he could do that because I was an existing customer. I was there to release my number from my parents account and start a new plan, add my wife, and get new phones. Yet according to the sales rep, it wouldn’t count and the full phone price would need to be paid because my number was already with T-Mobile. He said I could get a new phone number for myself and that would allow me to do it. I was surprised at this and since switching my phone number would be an extreme inconvenience, I asked him if I left T-Mobile for another carrier, would I qualify for the discount then. He replied that I could leave but I would get the discount until after I had left for 90 days and he “couldn’t guarantee the deal would still be here” when I come back.
My jaw was on the floor with this one. He then left to take a call and brought a younger representative over. The new rep told us about the same thing and was apologetic and started discussing other options, which started bringing us back out of our awful experience.

During this back and forth, I received a call from a “T-Mobile Expert” named Michelle and she lived up to the title of Expert. She was just calling to release my number from my parents plan but ended up handling the situation and getting me the deal I was asking about without any issues.

While I was talking to her on the phone, the gentleman I spoke to first was telling my wife at the kiosk that there was no way that the rep on the phone could get me the deal I wanted and made her feel very uncomfortable. He then came up behind me to try and get my attention to tell me the same thing and I had to plug my ear to hear the lady on the phone as he was right behind me saying, “Hey. It won’t stick after she does it. Hey. You won’t get that phone for that price.”

I eventually I had enough of this, turned around to get my wife, and we walked out of the store to sit in our car in the parking lot while we spoke on the phone. While we were on the phone in our car, the same man came out to the parking lot with a tablet and proceeded to wave at my wife on her side of the car to get her attention, she opened the door and he stated, ”I can show you right here that she cannot get you that deal.” I tuned over to him, thanked him for letting us know, and closed the door for her. We left after that and the rep on the phone was able to do everything else for us from there, ending our encounter with the store.

I was absolutely stunned by by this experience as I have never a bad encounter with T-Mobile prior to this. My family has been with T-Mobile for 12 years and switched from AT&T because of the price difference and great customer service by comparison. I can confidently say that if that T-Mobile Expert hadn’t called me she did, I would have changed carriers that day and most likely for good. My advice? Drive a few miles down the road to a different T-Mobile store and you’ll most likely not have the reps chasing you to your car to prove to you that you’re wrong.

name: Chris Matthews
text:
Recently I visited the Verizon Cellular Sales store on Madison Boulevard to discuss temporarily suspending service for my daughter who went to Italy this week for military duty and will be there for two years.  When I arrived Brittany greeted me at the door with a very pleasant personality.  I explained to her and Catherine, also pleasant, my situation and Catherine started the process for the suspension.  Alex was also nearby and provided very good information and advice during my visit.  While Catherine was on hold with the Verizon rep on the phone, she noticed from viewing my account that she could save me money by utilizing the promotion that was ongoing to pay off my daughter's phone and also upgrade my wife's.  Since my wife was at work at that time, I told Catherine and Brittany that I would return with her that evening to take care of everything.  When we returned we were greeted by Christie, one more person with warmth and courteousness, who helped us get started with the process once again.  Our experience was the best one we have had with any Verizon store in town.  We were made to feel right at home, and even when the process hit a snag, through no fault of their own, we were still pleased with the outcome.  Even Scott, who was not involved with assisting us, provided good conversation and hospitality.  In the end, my daughter's services were suspended, my wife upgraded her phone and my bill decreased by approximately $75.  After it was over we were still there 20 minutes later just talking.  We even "adopted" Brittany as our second daughter.  Everyone at that store are valuable assets to the Verizon company and brand.
JOB WELL DONE!

resp.text: Chris, thanks for that shout out! You just made our day. We’re always on the lookout for ways to better serve Cellular Sales customers and you’re helping us to serve even better. We appreciate you! -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Keep Tryin'
text: Became a Verizon Customer based on advertised military rebate flyer and salesperson of $200 per line. The flyer said buy or activate. Small print at the bottom written in legal said it had to be a phone financed thru Vzn. The Vzn sales guy vouched for the flyer. I'm not going to hire a lawyer every time I sign up with a cellular company to read the fine print. When I complained they did not give a reason online. I appealed with no reason given again. So I had to call and talk to a specialist who said it was clearly written.  I said it is not clear. If it's written in the fine print for all the layman folk in the world then we are getting ripped off. We're not going to read the fine print when the sales person said to buy it and it's written at the very bottom in size 5 font.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share, Burt. Please reach out to us with details of your visit at 877-851-0649 or Customerservice@cellularsales.com. -- Cellular Sales Customer Service

name: Latosha Taylor
text: Had a AT&T salesman to sell me two phones on Saturday. I was told that I had 3 days to exchange my phones with no issue. I called the salesman on Sunday and he agreed to meet with me on Monday but he had an emergency, and I was told to go to the store and swap phone out. I get to the Hoover AT&T store and was told that I would be charged a restocking fee and would have to pay additional taxes to swap phones, none of this I was told before hand. I am now stuck with a phone that does not have good service in my area at home and calls are dropping. I am not at all happy! Plus my old phones that were paid for , the salesman has them. This has been a horrible experience. I called the store and the manager is out of town and AT&T does not have a corporate office (per store rep) or anyone that can help me. I will have to leave a message. Again, this has been going on since Sunday... SMH!! If I had of known about the customer service or lack of info, I would have stayed with Tmobile.

resp.text: Latosha, we are very sorry to hear about the experience you had in our store! Please reach out to our Customer Support team at http://bit.ly/ATTExperience so that we can work with you to resolve these concerns!! Our mission is to make our customers #GenuinelyHappy, by creating a premier environment for our customers to shop! Thanks for being a loyal AT&T customer!!

name: Laura B
text: Just purchased new iphone at Pelham Store. Was told by "Chip" that their transfer equipment there was broken, so he gave me written instructions and a AT&T number to call to make file transfer from old phone to new iphone. I had no success! The next day I then went, conveniently, to the Galleria Store for help. Was simply told that "all was good with iphone from their (AT&T) end". I ask for assistance three times about how I can setup and transfer files myself to make new iphone operational. Was simply told by the young lady to "download transfer app to both phones". And how do I do that I ask... " follow the instructions" I was told. I ask can you help me through the process..."no, everything is fine on our end, you must take your (NEW) iphone to the MAC Store at the Summit! I left very frustrated, the process was not simple for me, and will now go back to AT&T a third time but back to the Pelham store to see "Chip" who was more helpful. NOT HAPPY!

resp.text: Laura, thanks for letting us know about the experience you had in our store! Please accept our sincerest apology, as it is our mission to make our customers #GenuinelyHappy. I'm really sorry we weren’t able to accomplish that for you this time!! Please reach out to us at http://bit.ly/ATTexperience, as we’d LOVE the opportunity to make it right! We look forward to hearing from you! Thanks for being the best part of AT&T!!

name: Kim Cauthon Kois
text:
I came into this store and upgraded to bogo special. This was in July, I changed my mind and carried both phone back to the representative that gave me the upgrade. Here it is 4 months later and I'm still paying for both phones and a extra line that I don't have!! I get the runaround every time I call. Suppose to have money credited back to my acct. And today when I get another bill. I call again, just for them to tell me the phones that I returned can't be found. Now I've got the receipts where I returned both items within the 14 day grace period, but they tell me that don't matter.
I'm getting very aggravated with these people that are suppose to be professionals in customer service.
They've got documentation where I returned the phones and charged me a restocking fee, I've got receipts where the store gave me for returning the items. But for some reason they are lost ( argh!!) and my receipts isn't going to help. Someone please tell me how this is possible or legal. This is so messed up. I guess I need to contact a attorney to try and recoup some of the money I've already paid these crooks.
My phone bill is normally 45.00 a month. Last month they cut it off after I was assured it wouldn't be disconnected untill this matter was resolved. I paid 484.20 to get my phone back on, and was assured the charges and extra line was removed, and that I had a 300.00 credit coming to me. Guess what this bill said....
259.41 the phones and extra line are still on there!#!  THIS NEEDS TO BE AND ALREADY SHOULD HAVE BEEN UNDER INVESTIGATION!!!!!!
#fedupwiththebullsh*t
#thisisunbelievable
#lostloyalcustomersafter this
#dotherightthing
#makeitright

text: I was told by Att uverse to bring in the equipment I had to the nearest Att store. I called to check on location and eligibility for this store on the galleria and a gentleman named Darrius answered the phone. I asked for help with this issue and he told me that I needed to go to a corporate store. When I asked him where the nearest one was, he told me to look it up. I didn't know there was a difference of else I would've called the right store. When u asked for his help to distinguish between the 2, he didn't want to help me at first until the 3rd time I asked him for help and he looked it up and gave me a number and told me to call it. No store location nothing. When I asked for his name just in case I  had to call back he asked me why I needed his name. Let's start with customer service. If you're an authorized retailer and you can't help all Att customers with Att issues them your franchise license needs to be pulled. This employee was rude and unhelpful. He acted like my problem wasn't his problem and treated me like I was nothing more than a begger on the street. Is this the way you want your store to represent Att? The fastest network and the poorest customer service? I would have a talk with Darrius about customer service. I'm going to bring this up with the corporate store. Fail.

name: Jacquelynn Thompson
text: I was disappointed to have an awful experience here about 4 months ago and everytime I step in this store. This is the only store I would go to for the 4 years we have lived here and have always had amazing customer service until now. Their employees are not well trained and I felt they told us whatever we wanted to hear to get us to buy new phones. We had to order our phones and when they came in it too 2 visits and 6 hours to get the phones activated. No one seemed to know what they were doing. We were told we would get a deal for trading in our phones. I'm still waiting for the deal to show on our bill even though I have been in twice to address the situation. They seemed inconvienced to do our trade in and made me come back for a separate visit to do so. Was told they were too busy to deal with everything I needed done on my account. It's disappointing how downhill customer service has gotten and I feel we were ripped off. Next time I will just do everything online myself.

resp.text: Thank you, Jacquelynn, for sharing your experience. If you need any further assistance, please contact our Customer Service Team at  877-851-0649 or customerservice@cellularsales.com. Reference case (372928). --Cellular Sales Customer Service

name: Ginger H
text: We have a large family using eight different devices and various accessories. Everyone has different needs and habits. Michael V. has been a great help to all of us making sure each person has the right phone for their needs and their habits. We have quite a variety of personalities; dad doesn’t like change, some of us are accident prone, and others use their devices to manage all aspects of their lives. Michael has helped us on several occasions find the right fit for each person not only in devices but even in the accessories for each person. He is very knowledgeable about all the devices and the accessories. Personally, I am amazed at his patience with all the questions many of which I am sure we asked more than once. Thanks to Michael I feel we all get the most out of our devices and make the most of all the bells and whistles for each device. We all are very busy juggling life in general and we struggle to find the time to visit the store once let alone for every issue or family member. Trying schedule with time with each family member is difficult in the best of times, but this year it has been even more difficult with the need to be cautious because of the pandemic. Michael is always willing to work with us to find a way to schedule us in and has on occasion been very understanding about last minute changes. During those visits to the store, he made sure we felt comfortable with the procedures in place for preventing the spread of COVID. From helping us schedule a time to visit  inside with reduce numbers to being willing bring purchases to the car. On two occasions, I have had to call him from out of state to help deal with phone issues.  The first time, I was on the other side of the country when my husband who was at home reluctantly needed to replace his five-year-old phone. Michael handled the situation with his usually wonderful manner coaxing my husband into a new phone and making sure the transition as painless as possible for my husband (and me!!). The most recent of those was when we were all out of state and my daughter’s phone  broke and she was driving in a different vehicle and needed to have a phone. Fortunately, we found an old phone for her to use because we couldn’t wait for insurance replacement. Michael took the time to walk us through the steps and called to follow up and make sure my daughter had everything set up so she could have access to a phone. It gives me great piece of mind to know that each family member has access to the help they need from someone we trust and are able to stay connected even when I or they are out of state. Thanks to Michael I believe we are getting the best value for our money. It seems like every time I talk to him; I save money. I can’t find the words to express how grateful I am for the piece of mind I have. THANK YOU Michael in my book you are the best!!!

We look forward to helping you with your future wireless needs!  -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Joseph Wilson
text: My review starts off bad but ends GREAT. I went  in to the store and talked to Kara about a note 8 and a new plan. She was a great at helping me. I was told what my plan was going to be and agreed to it. Then when I was about to pay my bill, I realized that it was way higher than I was told. I called the 800 number and the person informed me that with the unlimited plan you can not use you're work discounts. I was very aggverted to hear that. I was misinformed. The guy on the phone could do very little to fix the problem. At that point I was going to turn in my phone because it seemed to me that Verizon doesn't care about it's customers. But a day later Kara from Cellular sales prattville called me and apologized for misleading me. At first I figured it was just the company's way to make me stay. But as we talked and she told me what she can do to fix this and the whole time she kept telling me she was sorry I could hear it in her voice. Her actions and her dedication to me the customer was outstanding. Because of her I am keeping Verizon and I am extremely happy with my phone. Thank you Kara. If you go to this store I recommend waiting for her to help you even if she has a line of people already. Truley the best customer service I have ever had.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Joseph .  We strive for a high level of service and are glad to hear that Kara met that level!  Thank you for being with Cellular Sales!  -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Joshua F
text: I went in to find out what was wrong with a newer verizon iphone 8 that is less than 6 months old: The store representative told our options: upgrade the phone using another line ($$$) or use insurance claim ($199 deductible). The rep gave us customer service phone number and an insurance pamplet and sent us on our way. Turns out the device was covered under a WARRANTY.....customer service is replacing the device free of charge unlike this location that provided poor service quality to a customer who has been with Verizon for over 10 years. We will not be back to this location as calling a phone number was more useful instead of getting suckered into upgrading a device that is less than 6mo old or using insurance for a manufacturer defect. They also were unwilling to assist with applying a discount on the account and again gave me the number for customer service. The employee we delt with was a waste of oxygen and a waste of salary on behalf of any reputable business. I recommend going up the road to the main verizon wireless store as this location was not able to provide even basic assistance besides trying to make you believe you have to give them more money.

name: John Walker
text: About a month ago Kara (the tiny lady in the kid's clothes) was tasked with merging my freeloading old lady's account with my own. My initial impression: I'm sorry dear but can i speak to your manager (i.e. a man).... but it's 2018 so I gave her a chance... and I'm glad I did. Before i knew it she was guiding me through the process like Frodo led the Fellowship of the Ring. She was making calls, getting passwords and basically holding my hand through this entire process (don't tell my old lady, she won't appreciate the analogy.) She answered all of my questions and helped me save a bunch of money (which means more Bama stuff for me and the dogs! Roll tide!). Finally, she got corporate people one the phone and told me what to say to help me finish the transfer. When we were done our accounts merged like 2 souls coming together as one (that's a love making analogy). Thanks, Kara. I'll be sure to come to you if I ever need to upgrade to the new iphone X or Samsung S9.

name: Greg Smith
text:
How is it that Cspire only gives a new customer off the streets all the great deals and discounts that they advertise online BUT A LOYAL CUSTOMER for more than a decade gets told.."the phones you are interested in will be $300 EACH, with insurance....because its cheaper in the long run."
HOW LONG DOES 'THE RUN' HAVE TO BE BEFORE THEY GIVE THEIR LOYAL CUSTOMERS A BREAK!?!?! #shoppinnewcarriers.  Please give us back cellular south? Why would I have to sign up for anything[percs]? You should reward your long time customers by knowing when they come in and discovering they have been with your company for over a decade. I run a business and I can assure you that long time customers get preferential treatment over new customers. Just the reverse of your company.

resp.text: Hi Greg, we hate to hear that you're unhappy right now.  We assure that we do reward and appreciate our loyal customers, and we show our thanks with PERCS.  No other carrier rewards their customers like we do.  You can redeem PERCS Points for gift cards or discounts on accessories and phones.   If you would like to discuss this further, we would be glad to talk with you.  Email us at social@cspire.com.

text: While I think Verizon is a good company the store manager, Tom McGee, at the store on Winchester Road was dishonest, incompetent, made a racist comment about other races, said the F-word in front of my daughter when she went back in by herself, mishandled our private information, yanked my phone out of my hands repeatedly and demanded my password, and added products to our bill we stated repeatedly we did not want. We are out at least $500 because of this man and I’m worried about our private information.

name: Some One
text: I went in Jasper store the other day to change my service to Metro from AT&T. My friend went there 2 weeks prior to do the same new phone and all. She got her new phone free, case and screen protector free, walked out costing her around $75. She was treated well didn't  take her very long at all. Her AT&T phone she had stayed active for about a week before it shutdown. But when I am there I'm there for about 2-3 hours. I got a new phone free but was charged for my case and screen protector. The man that was working Matte says on receipt acted like he didn't even want to give me a receipt said printer wasn't working. I said can you at least give me a hand written one and sign it. A lady that was waiting her turn said take a picture of computer screen. I replied that will work as long as I have something to show the money I spent. He finally printed  receipt  but  acted  like  he  didn't  want  to. I ended up and spent right close to $140. I told Matte about my friend and how much she paid 2 weeks earlier. He acted like he didn't even hear a word I had said. I also told him about when I had done a search for Metro Pcs that I had seen offering for 2 phones 32gb and unlimited  service for 1 month for $75 and told him that's what I wanted. Go figure and look at amount I paid. He told me I had to wait about a week and come back in there for my new # and pay an additional $10 to get that done. He also told me my AT&T phone would no longer work. My friends phone did. Why didn't mine work that way? By the time he got my phone and stuff fixed up after being there so long my feet hurting from standing so long and needing to get home to my grandkids. I told him I would have to just come back another day to finish up I had to get home. He told me I would have to pay same amount again for other phone. Why is that I asked for 2 phones 2 new lines for unlimited talk, text and data. It was supposed to be $75 paid one time per month period. I have tried to call store several  times no answer, I have left messages asking for manager to call me left my # , No call back as of yet. Also having problems with service it says I have 2 bars on phone and I see the 4g on phone but can't make calls. My friend  is having that same issue. I have never felt with anything like this in my life. Oh and also the guy Matte that was working also kept my phone case I had on old phone. I never realized it until next day. If I could rate 0 I would.

name: james russell
text: I strongly recommend not using this service. I have been a customer for 4 years and they have lied to me in the worst pandemic this country has ever had. text: T-Mobile location Alabaster AL - WORST customer service I've seen in a long time.  Went in to see about moving all data from my old zte phone to a much newer phone my son gave me.   Was told they could not do anything because they didn't want customer to stay in store too long.  Was told I needed to "download" iTunes app to the new phone.  HOW CAN YOU DOWNLOAD AN APP TO A PHONE THAT IS NOT CONNECTED TO ANYTHING.  Was told "you just download it".   Totally rude and clueless employees.   Am switching to Spectrum mobile.

name: Randy Bolton
text: Has been a HORRIBLE experience switching to TMobile from Sprint. Not honoring the Promotion stated when I changed, and STILL have not seen the Payoff for the lines I transferred...Up to $600 per line for qualifying lines to switch. Lines qualified...month later, still no payment. They took my I phones and have not paid off Sprint or sent me a Check. By far the worst experience I have ever had with a Cell Phone Carrier!!!! Beware, you were warned!

resp.text: Hi Randy. I'm truly sorry to hear about the experience you had in our location, and the challenges you're having with your promotion rebates in switching over from Sprint. I would love to get some more info from you so I can work to get everything resolved with your promotions. Could you please send me an email at BriminghamStoreFeedback@T-Mobile.com with some contact info so I can reach out directly? I look forward to hearing from you soon! Thank you.

text: Awful! They are well going to give you the wrong information having you pay twice as much as you owe and let you wait for it! They told me that they could not get my bill fixed until July and my money could not be refunded by THEIR mistake! Also screw my mom up as well ! They called the “help line” to tell him that information but I believe he probably was talking to his mom by the information he gave me. I gave T-Mobile a call for myself and they fixed everything gave my money back and got my bill fixed for June.

name: Lashon Cain
text: AWESOME

name: André Garcia
text:
Worst T-Mobile dealer around!  AVOID !!!!!!
The folks working there are quite nice, but they are not trained properly and will provide misleading information that will cost your lots of money.

I switched over from Verizon on the "get out of the red" program, they assured me that T-Mobile would cover what I owned on my phones with Verizon up to $650 per line.  I also took a BOGO (buy one get one free) offer on the S8 .   I later found out that they were supposed to have filled out some information at the store, which was NEVER done.  I did that myself,  but as it turns out the Get out of the Red and Samsung BOGO are not eligible together.    I called Tmobile support and they told me the store should honor it and for me to go to the store, I went to the store, ALL of them admitted for misguiding me and gave me some directions on what to do next,  I tried it and it didn't work.
I went back to the store and spoke with Jamaica, she also admitted that they mislead me,  she called the store "owner" who basically told her that I'm out of luck and there is nothing he can do,  I asked to speak with him, and she said he was "busy" but would give me a call. He NEVER called me  back.

So long story short,  STAY AWAY from this location, they don't deserve anybody's business if they can't take care of their customers.  A BBB complaint is on the way.

name: Gail Powers
text: The Lady at T-Mobile was very Polite and concerned about the problem I was having,  in a matter of minutes she solved the problem and I was on my way 😏 Thank You

name: Bonnie Sherrow
text: Rod is the man to see if going to this store! I recently had busted the screen on my old phone and decided to give T mobile a try, I was greeted with great customer service, Rod helped fix me up with a good new phone at a decent price. The people here are very helpful and just awesome!

resp.text: We love our T-Mobile customers! Stop by and say hi any time!

name: T Voss
text: Definitely ask for Rod! He is the absolute best. His customer service goes above and beyond. I have been in this particular store numerous times and have dealt with other associates. Rod is my favorite, hands down. I went in today after worrying all night that I would have to replace my phone or do a hard reset and lose everything. Rod happily greeted me, heard my sad story, and had my phone fixed and I was out the door in less than three minutes. He knew exactly what was going on with my phone and how to fix it that fast. If you have to make an appointment, make sure it's with him. Or maybe you'll be lucky enough to have him help you if you just walk in!

name: m wilson50
text: Yeah, no, sorry folks. Either someone is filtering these reviews or I am talking about the wrong store. We went to this establishment on a Saturday morning, we were literally the very first and only people going through the front door. Once we made it past the "Mask-wearing police," we were treated to impressive levels of ineptitude and indifference. The little braid-haired teenager that "assisted" us seemed more interested in singing and dancing to the overhead music than doing anything that resembled a job. She finally wasted enough of our time such that we left and drove to a different location. Nice try with these corny one-line reviews, this place is a joke.

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear this M Wilson. That’s not the experience we want for our customers! Can you email me at GulfCoastStoreFeedback@T-Mobile.com, so I can get this fixed for you?

name: Shawn P
text: Have been to the store twice this week - 2 sim cards and a plan change - and was helped by Jasmine & Rod.  They were very helpful, polite/courteous, knowledgeable, patient with us we asked questions, and were a pleasure to visit with.  Rod suggested a plan to help save us some money and helped sort out the initial billing.  I have been to stores like this for other carriers and in other cities over the years and never had as good of an experience as we have had here - wish I could give more than 5 stars!

resp.text:
Thank you so much Shawn! We appreciate you stopping by to see us. We love Jasmine and Rod!

Thank you so much for the feedback ! If you have any additional feedback, please feel free to reach out to me directly at GulfCoastStoreFeedback@T-Mobile.com.

text: I had an appointment to talk with one of the T-Mobile Representatives in regards to a problem I was having with my telephone. The team there was very nice and was able to help resolve my problem. Making the appointment was much smoother than I thought it would be.

name: Kallie Jackson
text: I wanted to change my phone plan and in order to do so, I had to get a new SIM card, requiring me to visit the store. Long story short, my number wasn’t porting, Junior had two phones on hold with customer service, calling and messaging other people to try & get my phone back up before they closed at 8:00. At 7:35, I told him I’d survive without my phone for a night & went home. Phone was finally working at 9:00 the next day (and yes! I survived!). Junior called when he got in to work to verify the phone was in working order. He was so patient & I just want to thank him for all his help.

resp.text: Hooray!! I am so glad you had a great experience in the store Kallie!! Thank you for your review!! Come back in anytime, we're here to help!! I will be sure to give Junior the recognition he deserves! Be sure to download the T-Mobile Tuesdays app-You will get free stuff every Tuesday!

text: I’m so mad right now I could scream! My daughter and I went in today to upgrade her phone. text: Don't bother making an appointment...we made an appt. a week in advance...when we showed up, they just added us to the end of the queue so still waited over an hour to speak to an associate.. if we had not driven an hour to the store, we would have just left.

name: Courtney Broadfoot
text: I've never been to a Verizon store with customer service that was this poor. We've been Verizon customers for 10 years and have always had great experiences, but today was TERRIBLE. The sales associate did not give me any helpful information or explain the phone plans or the phone features outside of what was already posted on the wall. I asked on multiple occasions to get more information, to which he replied with short, one word answers. DO NOT COME HERE if you want help decided on phone plans or phones. He did not help me set up my new phone, he just gave me the bag (without opening the box or anything) and told me I could set it up at home even after I had asked for help. I ended up just leaving and am now trying to figure it out by myself. What a disappointing experience...

resp.text: Hi Courtney, thanks for sharing your review. We know how important it is to get your new phone set up, and we're sorry to hear you've had a difficult time getting support. We certainly want to help you and truly value the years you've been with us. We are always listening to our customers and making improvements. We hope you visit us again so we can help you out.

text: employees are rude there.  Kicked my friend I asked to go pick up my MIFI device.  I called ahead and gave his name and my pin.  They never answered the phone.  Corperate said they left a note on the account to honor my request.  The store staff refused to talk to me or my friend.  WORST STORE EVER.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your friend's experience at our store, Kristin. You should always be treated with respect and professionalism when you visit us and get the assistance you need. We're disappointed we let you down and will review your comments further with our Spanish Fort team. We hope you'll give us a chance to make this right by revisiting us soon.

text: I used to love this store, and would drive 100 miles to do business with them.  I bought an iphone xr and they sold me a $50.00 screen protector telling me it was a lifetime replacement package on it.  When I went back into the store to have it replaced, they said I had to call Zagg.  I tried several times but the numbers would no work.  Something has changed and I can no longer get any service from them.  I could have bought a protector screen for $5.00 not fifty, but thought they would handle the problem if it came to it.  Very unhappy and  will not shop with them again ever...........

resp.text: We're sorry you did not have a great experience in our store, Mike. We always want to make sure we are being completely transparent so that we may avoid any issues. We will be escalating your review so that the appropriate team can look into your concerns. We hope you'll give us another chance to provide a better experience in the future.

We appreciate your feedback, and we hope you'll give us another chance to provide an easy and seamless experience on your next visit.

name: steve wong
text:
I have 10 lines under family plan and I float line #10 to friends/relatives when they are visiting occasionally. I lost the SIM card and wanted to have a replacement (and this is not the first time I had done it with other stores).  Walked into the store and was told that it cannot be done because I didn’t have a device with me despite I told them it is a Spare line. I even asked them to use the iPhone I carried with line #1 to activate the sim card. But the staff and manager refused to help.

I have spoken to the Verizon rep via app chat and they were way more helpful and were willing to ship a SIM card to me immediately.

Try other stores in the area if you need to go to the store and avoid this one at all cost!!!!!

Calling and chatting online would be more pleasant.

name: Ralph Burns
text: Due to having issues with my phone not wanting to charge correctly,  I visited the Verizon store in Spanish Fort, AL. When I first bought my Galaxy S7 Edge, it would say Fast Charging: Approximately 1 hour 37 mins until fully charged from 0%.  I told the technician that I've been having to charge it wirelessly because my phone charging port hasn't been working correctly. Charging my phone wirelessly, it says Approximately 2 hours 50 minutes until fully charged from 0%. The technician plugged my phone up and it started charging. My phone was on 47% and within a few minutes, it reached 50%. He said it appears to be working correctly to me and that he could sell me a new charger. I told the technician that I didn't want to buy a new charger because I bought a new charger a few days before and it started fast charging; however, when my phone reached 50% the charger stopped working. My roommate has the same exact phone, so he plugged his phone into the charger, and it wouldn't work for his phone either. I plugged my phone into his charger and it started fast charging again, but after using his charger, his charger stopped working. When I plug my phone to the original charger,  it says "Phone will take too long to charge. Approximately 8 hours 45 mins until fully charged, please connect phone to original charger in order to charge phone. Clearly the chargers aren't  the problem. The phone is corrupting all the chargers.

name: mrryanrytyclark
text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. I have never had a worse experience at a retail store than I did last week. We were completely mislead about a promotion that was going on, went forward with a purchase and then they reneged on part of the promotion 6 days after. A total lack of transparency and complete misrepresentation of the promotion and sale. The manager was rude and condescending when I spoke to him after the fact, it was made out like it was all my fault and that the sales person simply "mispoke". When I preceded to ask for a Regional or District Manager to talk to about my experience he would not give any info to me. We have been customers with Verizon for over 15 years and have bought multiple phones at this location since it opened a few years ago, and am at a total disbelief that they would let a valued and loyal client be treated that way. I will never visit this location again and advise people not to. I am not the type of person to leave reviews and complain but I want to warn other consumers to not fall for the fake and misrepresented "promotions" that are not true.

name: Matthew McAnally
text:
There's a corporately owned store in Jones Valley FYI

Ask for Devon. If he's still employed there, leave.

October 31st - Went into the store to trade in two iPhone SE 2020's(currently being paid for with installments) for 2 iPhone 12's(one pro one not). The rep, Devon, was dipping the entire time he helped us. It took longer because he was describing how he had lost another customer's money by entering wrong info into their system, and was making sure he didn't do the same with us. It was busy, so I decided to wait him out. We were offered two options for upgrading the devices:

1 - Pay of the SE 2020's in full for $720-ish and trade them in for a $440 promotional value applied over 24 months towards the new phones.

2 - Trade in the 2020's towards their own outstanding balance, making the payoff balance ~$360, then starting the iPhone 12's fresh.
I opted for door # 2 as it would be only $160 more over the 2 years, but would be $360 less today.

Nov 1st - Devon disagreed I guess and called me letting me know that it wasn't his fault, but I would have to go pay another $360 to his store, BUT IT'S OKAY I'M GETTING THE PROMOTION I DIDN'T ASK FOR. He really stressed, many times, that it wasn't his fault.

I let him know that it wasn't going to fly, and he said he was going to call his boss and call me back in five minutes.

Eight hours later, I get a text from Devon: Verbatim "Hey man I just got a response from my higher up. You can't put it on your bill you will have to go back to the store and pay it"

I asked for said higher up to give me a call. I guess his definition of "higher up" is his customer service trainer. Said trainer started the call with a "here we go" long sigh and then told me that they know he's a problem, it was his fault, and I still have to pay $360. I ask what time they open the next day and he tells me they open at 9. They open at 10. I then ask if there is someone competent that will be there. He says someone competent will be there at 10:30. Seems kind of insulting to whoever was there before 10:30.

Nov 2nd - The competent employee was indeed competent though. It took 30 minutes of sitting in front of the counter at the store while the competent employee talked to exactly one person and had it fixed. It was painless enough to bring a star back to what is honestly a 0 star experience.

Devon called me a few minutes after I left the store to let me know that he had fixed the problem. I let him know that, no he didn't, competent employee did. He then began stressing that he was calling to let me know so I wouldn't have to go up to the store. As if his good intentions would make up for the error, the lack of effort to fix it, the attempt to put me in contact with people who wouldn't get him in trouble, and finally lying to me trying to take undue credit for fixing a problem that he created.

They then offered me a discount on a phone case or accessory for my troubles. They were out of what I wanted.

name: e t
text:
NOT a VERIZON Corporate Store.  BEWARE!!!!

So first of all, this is not a real Verizon store.  It is the same thing as going to a kiosk in a mall to get a phone or change a phone plan.  You won't see this tidbit of information anywhere unless you really look or ask specifically.

The employees work on commissions and therefore don't have your best interest in mind.  They will peddle the phones and plans with the best kickbacks (go in and ask about an iPhone and see what they say about it; most assuredly they will try to discourage those phones as the commissions are much lower than Samsung/LG etc.)

The employees also do not put out the correct information.  They twist the truth to try to sell and change your plans.  They updated my account to the Verizon Unlimited data plan from the 16GB plan and when we specifically asked if there would be a speed or service difference, we were told no; it's identical.  OOPS!!  After numerous dropouts and super slow data service, when when on 4G, we called Verizon and was told that the plan we're on is the first to be 'booted' off a tower or throttled due to bandwidth issues.  Fortunately Verizon (the real Verizon) was able to fix our account and put us back to the plan we had where we will get good service again.

Lesson learned here.  We will NEVER again go to a non-Verizon store (except Costco, their reps are pretty good) and certainly will not set foot in this store again.  The number of untruths and misleading info makes me regret patronizing this place.

If your an authorized retailer for a simple sim card there should not be a fee. I will not be back in there again not for anything! Seems the point of authorized retailers is to rip you off.

text: Love MetroPCS! Knowledgeable employees, service more dependable than Verizon at a much better cost with the same high end telephone. They even have an easy pay program for the more expensive phones. I have no complaints with my switch or service and will never go back to a contracted plan!

name: Chris Shaw
text:
My wife went to this store last night to check something on our account. She was going to add a line, however, there was an older male employee who was disrespectful to her.

He told her one thing earlier in the week and then when she went in on Thursday, he had said something different and had sold her phone from the safe. However, my wife was not rude she just let it go and was going to choose a new phone. He then came up to her and asked her a question and when she replied he wanted to debate about what he originally said so she corrected him polietly. Well so she asked if another employee could ring her up because she was uncomfortable by him and he told her the store was closed and she would need to come back in the morning.

She was there 15 mins before closing and she had the right to be served and she told him that but he still refused and told her to leave and to come back in the morning. She asked for his name so she can report him and he refused to give it to her.  So needless to say she left in tears because she was angry because he was lying ad being rude.

So we are going to call head quarters and report him. I would not recommend this store simply because this is not the first I heard of them being rude to there customers. We will be switching services.

name: Angela Trucks
text:
Service was great! The young lady helped us by getting an upgrade on our phones. We got three phones upgraded w/unlimited everything for $100.00 a month. This is split three ways costing each of us $33.33 each. Also at any time I can add more lines for $25.00 a month per line.
I love Metro PCS ❤️ They were helpful.

name: Alyce Woodruff
text: We've used Metro as you can see for years and yesterday when we added another line I was very unhappy with your worker. It was very hot yesterday and my wife and I had just picked up a puppy, she was in her purse. Your worker told her to leave. No one was in the store, she wasn't barking, however, she was hot. My wife left and stood in the hot sun. Your worker told me that she was allergic to dog's.  She gave this phone number to us. 666-3331. Really? She wouldn't give us another. After leaving we noted her leaving your business unintended, without locking, and going next door to the dollar store. So, I guess it's ok to leave your business unintended, but your policy is to let your customers suffer in the heat. Smh!

text: I normally don't post reviews but I recently had a not so pleasant experience with this particular location. We went in to add a line to my account and update our phones and the first person to help us wasn't very helpful and had to keep asking for help and even clocked out and left before we were even done getting our new phones set up. I asked several times what my new bill would be and never could get an answer as well as asked several times to add my boyfriend (whom I was getting the extra line for) as someone who could access the account and was told several times that they would do it but they never did. After she left another guy came in and proceeded to "help" us. I put that in quotations because it wasn't very helpful. While we were trying to activate our new phones, my boyfriend was made to feel stupid for not knowing exactly what to do because he works outdoors and doesn't know a whole lot about technology. Several times jokes were made about him. After being there for over an hour setting up our phones ourselves and being made to feel dumb when we had a question, we were told that we could leave (even though one of our phones wasn't even usable yet)  only to get a call once we were almost home to be asked if we could send a pic of one of the boxes because they never finished cashing us out. They got their money and sent us on our way without making sure everything was finalized and we were so ready to leave and upset because of the way they made my boyfriend feel, we didn't even realize that the paper they put into the bag wasn't a final receipt.
