name: Gregory Eagerton
text: Was not able to complete the process of setting up in-store appointment online so called store and got prompt response to call by Randall.  He immediately set up appointment for later that day so that we could review plans and upgrade phones.  He was waiting at door to greet us at the appointment time; he was the ultimate professional and walked us through the process identifying how we could have better service at a more cost efficient price.  He then reviewed each phone that we were interested in and matched our needs with the right phone.  He never once attempted to "over-sell" us which has never been our experience in the past when purchasing phone equipment.  He then reviewed upgrade discount offers and walked through the data transfer process from old phone to new.  We were in and out in about 45 minutes which is an all time record.  Randall was the most professional, personable, and honest phone services representative we have ever worked with and it made a huge difference in my perception of how this was going to be.  The store was well prepared to practice safe social distancing and managing customers so that we felt completely "COVID safe".  Highly recommend the store and certainly, if you have the option of customer representatives, work with Randall!

name: Rob McDonald
text: My Jetpack hotspot was never very good, and finally just stopped taking a charge when the battery swelled. There was a recall (I was not notified, but saw a sign when I arrived), but the rep said I'd have to jump through a bunch of hoops and be without my hotspot to have it handled under the recall. As I use my hotspot for work every day, that wouldn't work. So my only remaining option was to upgrade to a better unit and pay over $150 for that, which I had to do. The new unit seems to work better, but I didn't appreciate being forced to pay more to replace a recalled product or wait for some undetermined amount of time without use of my hotspot. I don't know whether this was a store policy or Verizon's, but it isn't great customer service either way.

resp.text: Thank you for making us aware of your experience, Rob. If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact our team at 877-851-0649 or customerservice@cellularsales.com. -- Cellular Sales Customer Service

name: James Clarke
text: These folks were super helpful! The wait time was not non-existent but no longer than normal. That said, I never felt like they forgot about me while I was sitting there waiting. I went in because my phone wasn't working and was preprepared for them to try to get me to buy a new phone. Instead, they worked really hard to try to fix my phone and then when that didn't work they determined it was a manufacturer's defect and replaced it at no cost. They never tried to nickle-and-dime me at all. I don't love going to to verizon but this was easily the best experience I've had at a verizon store.

WE LEFT ANGRY AND WITHOUT PHONES!

name: Michael Benoit
text:
A honest mistake was made by T-Mobile salesperson on last two weeks ago.   They forgot to put insurance on new phone.  Note: I have paid for insurance for 17 years.   Yes 17 years.  As luck would have it.  I cracked my screen.   The saleswoman called there corporate office  who at first told me I never had insurance.  Until I pulled up last month's bill and showed them.   Then refused to Correct issue and put insurance back on the phone.  Then tells me i have to pay a $400 penalty for my damaged phone.

Keep in mind my phone is still under factory warranty and I have been paying for insurance for 17 years up to when salesman forgot to put it on new phone I got.

17 years of paying.  And they refused to accept that the salesman made a mistake and instead penalized me $400.  They could care less what I was trying to explain. They refused to accept any kind of responsibility.  Worst customer service experience ever.

If not fixed.   I assure you it will be the last payment T-Mobile will ever get.

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear this Michael. That’s not the experience we want for our customers! Can you email me at birminghamstorefeedback@t-mobile.com so I can get this fixed for you?

text: The absolute worst experience I have ever had with a phone company!! My wife and I switched from Verizon to T-Mobile because they were cheaper. Well its true that you get what you pay for. The first person we dealt with was the root of the problem. Heavier set Lady; I didn't get her name. She was suppose to check the T-Mobile coverage in my area, which was really a general search of Huntsville.  When we sat down with Ethan, another sales associate, we were told we would get a $350 rebate to cover the cost of our phones with Verizon. That didn't happen. Called customer service they said there was no indication of a rebate. when we got home both of the T-Mobile phones said no service. when we went back the next day the guy behind the counter asked for our area code to check the service in our area, which the first person didn't ask for and it showed low to moderate coverage.  I could go on and on with what didn't happen, but the bottom line is you get what you pay for.

name: Amber Moser
text: If i could I would give this place zero stars horrible customer service. I went in to get an upgrade, Jennifer the sales rep tells me that because of a labor day promotion if i buy a phone its going to come with a case and a screen protector. So Im like cool, I wasn't really trying to get a case or a screen protector but if its included might as well right. She hooks my phone up and the price comes out to like 203.00 which honestly isn't a big deal but im confused as to how a 129.00 phone has 70 dollars worth of taxes, activation fees, and what not considering its not a new line. So Im like ill just go somewhere else cause honestly I could probably get a way better phone with a way better company else where. So she gets my price down to 164.14 which sounds more realistic. Checks me out and hands me the phone. No case no screen protector. So im like wheres the case and screen protector. She then begins to tell me the truth. That in fact the extra 35.00 is for the case and screen protector which wouldnt have ever been an issue had she just told me the cost up front instead of misleading me to believe it would be included with the price of the phone. These scandalous sales tactics are junk. Worse than buying a used car from a lot when the salesman knows the car is a lemon. Just be up front and honest. Dont try and hustle your customers. The entire time im standing there believing theres 70 dollars worth of activation fees and taxes and she never once told me she was charging me for the case and screen protector. Then the manager Allyson comes in to play and says well they are buy one get one free. So your telling me a screen protector cost 35.00? Or a phone case cost 35.00? It kinda sounds petty but my frustration comes from the fact that this sales rep is a liar and a fraud. So be sure to ask questions if you go there of the price doesn't sound legit because chances are Jennifer has mislead you to purchase something you probably didn't want.

text: This company is  no good I got conned into buying a are blade max z and it crapped out on me in a couple of months ZTE sent me another phone but charge me for shipping  . After asking for a better phone because even the one they sent did not work right I changed companies.  Now in Aug 1 2014 Obama signedinto public law S.517 Pub.L 113-144 this law is in effect and states that if you own the device and not under contract and wish to unlock your device for use with another carrier theycan not deny you well metro pcs has denied me and I cant use my phone that I own not them. I hqve left word with U.S. Senate's man Mr Leheay he was the Senate member who pushed the bill and got it passed and sent before obama . If anyone else is having this issue contact Senate Mr Leheay he is going to go after metro pcs

name: Mrs. Houston
text: I advise anyone looking to get a cell phone to avoid this retailer they have terrible service, they will lie to you about the service of their phones,you will be paying a bill for 4G but I guarantee you you won't receive 4G service the phones are just awful, constantly dropping calls, at times not letting you make calls, hard to receive pictures and send them, just avoid MetroPCS, just because they are partnered with T-Mobile does it mean you're going to get good service, that's how they try to get you in the door making you think you're getting T-Mobile, but you're not, you're getting basic cheap service for a T-Mobile price!!
